posts.post_content: Its a bit pricey, but can be spaced out over two turns. What I like about this card is it gives you exile without stacking your deck with exile instant cards. Handy way to get rid of all those unearth and persist cards. Otherwise your stuck to a set of unmake, or the slightly less powerful but very helpful oblivion ring. Instead you can have 1 card that keeps on working for you as long as it stays in play. The biggest downside is simply the mana cost.
posts.html:
Its a bit pricey, but can be spaced out over two turns. What I like about this card is it gives you exile without stacking your deck with exile instant cards. Handy way to get rid of all those unearth and persist cards. Otherwise your stuck to a set of unmake, or the slightly less powerful but very helpful oblivion ring. Instead you can have 1 card that keeps on working for you as long as it stays in play. The biggest downside is simply the mana cost.

posts.post_content: I just realized that since the "exiletouch" is a triggered ability, it won't work if the creature is in the graveyard when it resolves. Most creatures aren't going to survive getting smacked by a creature with +5/+5, so this card won't lead to many creature being exiled in combat. Still a good card, though, especially if you can [Dagsson](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=122124) up its friends.
posts.html:
I just realized that since the "exiletouch" is a triggered ability, it won't work if the creature is in the graveyard when it resolves. Most creatures aren't going to survive getting smacked by a creature with +5/+5, so this card won't lead to many creature being exiled in combat. Still a good card, though, especially if you can Dagsson up its friends.
